discovery.instruction: Start a new Shelley conversation and reference the worker file: 'Read {worker_file} and follow the instructions'

launch.notes: Shelley runs as a web service on exe.dev VMs. Workers are launched via the shelley-worker wrapper script.

autonomy.notes: Shelley operates with high autonomy in exe.dev VMs. File and git operations are auto-approved.

documentation.getting_started: Shelley is exe.dev's native coding agent, accessible via web UI at https://vmname.exe.xyz:9999/. It has full access to the VM filesystem, can run shell commands, browse the web, and spawn subagents for parallel work. For Czarina integration, each worker runs in its own Shelley conversation with access to its git worktree.
tips: Shelley has native bash access - git operations work seamlessly
Use subagents for parallel subtasks within a single worker
Shelley can browse the web and take screenshots for verification
Previous conversation history is stored in SQLite and can be queried
Shelley supports multiple LLM models (Claude, GPT, Gemini, etc.)
Worker prompts work best as markdown files with clear task lists
Shelley persists across browser sessions - work continues where you left off
limitations: One active conversation per browser tab (use multiple tabs for parallel workers)
Requires exe.dev VM with Shelley service running
API access requires X-Exedev-Userid header (internal use)

examples.title: Start a worker task
examples.description: Begin work on an assigned task
examples.command: Open https://vmname.exe.xyz:9999/, start new conversation, say: 'Read .czarina/workers/engineer1.md and begin Task 1'

examples.title: Check worker status
examples.command: sqlite3 ~/.config/shelley/shelley.db "SELECT slug, updated_at FROM conversations ORDER BY updated_at DESC LIMIT 5;"

examples.title: Launch parallel subagent
examples.description: Use Shelley's subagent tool for parallel work
examples.command: In Shelley: 'Spawn a subagent to handle the test writing while I work on implementation'

examples.title: Create PR after completion
examples.description: Use gh CLI for PR creation
examples.command: gh pr create --title 'feat: implement feature X' --body 'Closes #123'

integration.notes: Shelley doesn't use tmux for session management. Each worker runs in a separate browser tab/conversation. Status can be monitored via the SQLite conversation database.
